intro: Urtica dioica subsp. pubescens, commonly known as stinging nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its hairy, stinging leaves and stems. It belongs to the Urticaceae family and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant features opposite, heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in woodland edges, fields, and along stream banks. Urtica dioica subsp. pubescens is known for its defensive stinging hairs, which release irritants when touched.
